body_html:
@sarah-zaheer Were it me, i'd build the wheel and pip install into a virtualenv or a conda env. If you don't want to go that route, you could change the path, but try pointing it at

bazel-out/darwin_x86_64-opt/bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/org_tensorflow

to pick up everything (adjusting that path for the name of your build architecture as necessary.)
body:
@sarah-zaheer Were it me, i'd build the wheel and pip install into a virtualenv or a conda env. If you don't want to go that route, you could change the path, but try pointing it at
```
bazel-out/darwin_x86_64-opt/bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/org_tensorflow
```
to pick up everything (adjusting that path for the name of your build architecture as necessary.)
